'American Spring' (known as "Spring" from 1971-72) were a 1970s pop music duo
formed in Los Angeles, composed of sisters Diane Rovell and Marilyn Wilson, who
had earlier been members of girl group The Honeys. As with the Honeys, Beach Boy
Brian Wilson (Marilyn's then-husband) played an integral role with American
Spring, producing some of their recorded material.
